RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 86. Claiming Purse 16000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JUNE 2, 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 2, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OUR FREDDIE MAC stalked the pace while racing in the four path, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, was encouraged as he circled the field in the turn, drew next to the early leaders and challenged for the lead, took control by the three eighths pole and held sway from there getting another win. CUSTOM BLUE GRASS was off in the middle of the field, raced in the four path, launched a id at the three eighths pole, followed the eventual winner around the bend, stalked until the eighth pole, was encouraged and hand ridden, responded well and began inching closer to the winner but it was not enough today. SHARP CHARLIE was off near the back of the field, raced in the five path, advanced at the half mile pole, shifted into the seven path at the three ei ghths pole and circled the field wide, chased the front runners down the stretch out finishing the rest. BIG BELLA BROWN was pinched back in the first few strides of the race, settled off of the pace, improved at the half, raced in company, angled into the sic path after the three eights pole, closed, gaining mildly. SCHNELL shuffled back, trailed the field by many, was patient and waited, raced along the rail and saved ground, was asked and responded to encouragement by closing quickly racing a good last quarter but had to much to do. YES BAB was off mid pack, raced three wide, shifted into the rail at the three eighths pole and smartly saved ground, but had no late kick. DIABLO CAT vied for the lead, raced in the three path, raced on the outside of two other competitors while setting the pace, was challenged by an outside rival, battled, could not sustain the bid and flattened out. FAREWELL TIME vied for the lead, had company to the outside, led and set the pace in a set of three, raced on the rail and saved ground through out, was challenged at the five sixteenth pole and gave way. GOLD MERRITT vied for the lead, raced in between rivals, was pinched back at the three eights pole as the eventual winner entered the turn, lost momentum and faltered after that.

ENTRY.NAME: Farewell Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led in a set of 3, rail, pace, inside, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Yes Bab
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3w, shift4ed inside turn finished even

ENTRY.NAME: Gold Merritt
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, between rivals, pinched back 3/8, lost momentum

ENTRY.NAME: Big Bella Brown
ENTRY.COMMENT: pinched, settled, moved 1/2, shifted 6 wide, 3/8, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Our Freddie Mac
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 4w, bid 3/8, encouraged turn, battled, led 3-16th, held

ENTRY.NAME: Custom Blue Grass
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, bid 3/8, was encouraged stretch, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Sharp Charlie
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 5w, shifted 7 wide turn, circled, closed, up for 3rd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 5F Turf CR: 71. Maiden Claiming Purse 15000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KISS UPON A STAR was off mid pack, raced in the three path as she rated, shifted 6w upper, stalked the leader until the eighth pole, was asked and in a burst passed the leader getting up in time for the win. HIDDEN LOVE stalked the leader from the three path while she raced in between rivals, moved up at the five sixteenth pole, bid a the three sixteenth pole, challenged for the lead with the early leader, put that one away, was hooked by another competitor, matched strides with that one but just missed for the win, still running a game, smart race. NEVER WALK ALONE vied for the lead, took the lead and set the pace, raced in the three path through out, still had the lead entering the furlong ground, was challenged and relinquished the lead, still a well run third. VIVI DID IT was off a step slow, was allowed to find her stride, raced on the rail, saved ground through out, started gaining ground at the half mile marker, continued to close on the rail through the stretch drive, angled out into the three path to avoid traffic but to no avail. LITTLE Z hopped at the start, trailed the field, raced on the rail, mild gain late. CHACHA TO CATALINA stalked the pace, raced in the four path, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, angled into the six path in the upper stretch, but had no finish and came up short. RUN AWAY SAMARI stalked the pace, raced in the three path and in between rivals, slowly drifted back. SHESTHEBIGGAME stalked the front runners from the three path, raced in between foes, saved ground, shifted into the rail, was in contention at the eighth pole then tired at the sixteenth pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Little Z
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, trailed, rail, mild gain late

ENTRY.NAME: Vivi Did It
ENTRY.OWNER: Elite Thoroughbred Racing LLC and Respect the Valleys LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, trailed, rail, saved ground, one run

ENTRY.NAME: Kiss Upon a Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3w, rated, 6 wide, upper, bid 1/8, burst passed leader

ENTRY.NAME: Shesthebiggame
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, between, saved ground, shifted rail, tired 1/16th

ENTRY.NAME: Hidden Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, between, saved ground, battled, led, battled, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Chacha to Catalina
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 4w, bid 3/8, angled 6 wide, upper, no finish

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 94. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 15000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $7,500 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023 OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 2, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claim ing Price $12,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: UNANIMOUSLY ran mostly in the three and four path, had a steady increase of pace throughout the race and dueled LIARS CLUB for the last hundred yards. RANDELLO ran in mid pack off pace then had a late interest coming on to the stretch driving hard on the rail. LIARS CLUB got out front early on, set a comfortable lead then got caught mid stretch by UNANIMOUSLY, dueled until they finished the race. OAK HILL LG ran on the rail, was off pace of RANDELLO, stalked most of the race. MEANT FOR ME started out strong, faded mid back stretch, moved to the rail to stalk OAK HILL LG off pace. TWITTY CITY had a slight interest, then faded at the beginning of the stretch. VIM AND VIGOR started off mid pack then slowed pace. PROMISING SHOES hung in eighth place throughout the race. KEYS INCLUDED had a bumped start, was never involved. THERE WAS A TRAINERS OBJECTION AND A STEWARDS INQUIRY TWITTY CITY ON OAK HILL LG, THE STEWARDS DETEREMINED NO CHANGE TO ORDER OF FINISH.

ENTRY.NAME: Twitty City
ENTRY.COMMENT: very mild gain, faded on main stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Liars Club
ENTRY.COMMENT: set early pace 2 wide, just missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 7 1/2F Turf CR: 62. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOOKIN AT BETTY ducked in at the start, ran most of the race in the three path then coming down mid stretch had a strong late rally to catch BUD WON with fifty yards left. BUD WON had a strong break ran in the two path most of the race, just missed very late into the race. LAKESIDE RUMBLE ran of pace from the leaders had a very late gain to obtain the podium. TAPIT TWICE maintained an even bid throughout the race then had a late interest coming into the second turn. SWEET PRESENT ran on the rail throughout the race and maintained an even pace. SPOONMAN set an early pace then slowed pace. ROCKALL had a strong break then evened out the pace in the middle of the pack. ALWAYS HAVE PARIS ran off pace of SWEET PRESENT then maintained an even pace. DABOOGEYMAN missed the break then trailed throughout the race. STRIKE A BARGAIN had a strong break then faded mid back stretch. KING SAUL wasnt really involved, faded to last.

ENTRY.NAME: Lakeside Rumble
ENTRY.OWNER: Simpson Bruce and Simpson Sarah H

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Maiden Special Weight Purse 27000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For A Claiming Price Of Less Than $25,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HALFPRICED set the early pace on the rail went gate to wire. LOUISIANA COWGIRL ran in the three path had an increasing pace throughout the race to dead heat. LAWLESS TIMES ran on the rail, off the pace from the leaders then had a late interest mid turn. BRIELLE EVANGELINE ran in the four path then maintained pace throughout. BAYOU BEAUTY ran in the five path with a even pace. SASSY SPRY ran in the four path with a flat pace. TRIPLE THE GOLD ran a strong pace dueled early on then faded mid turn in the three path. NIGHT TIZZY ran on the rail maintained a steady pace with no kick. LUCKY BEAD LADY ran in the 3 path with a flat pace no final kick. DELTA NIGHTS trailed on the outside with a very late kick. CHUCHI ran in the two path with little to no interest. JENNYSBIGBABY ran on the rail and faded at the start of the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Lawless Times
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace rail late interest mid turn

ENTRY.NAME: Night Tizzy
ENTRY.OWNER: Beene Linda D and Rowe Stephen

ENTRY.NAME: Triple the Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled early faded mid turn 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 5F Turf CR: 70. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main tra ck at Five Furlongs).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THE RAGE OF ART ran of pace until the sixteenth pole then shot the gap in the middle of the pace with a very strong late rally. LEXINGTON DIVA ran on the rail then followed THE RAGE OF ART thru the gap in the middle of the track. MY LADY LUNA ran in the three path until the sixteenth pole, then had a strong kick on the outside. LUNCH LADY ran in the two path then on the stretch drifted out to the six path. OOCHIE ran in the two path mid pack with a maintained pace. TWO HANDS FULL ran on the rail with an even pace. FLOWERS APRIORITY ran on the rail then shuffled back when approaching the finish. LITTLE E slowed after break with no final kick. SHARONS'MOONSHADOW was never involved after the first furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Flowers Apriority
ENTRY.OWNER: Jeansonne Justin Virgadamo Rodney and Bonura Keith

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Super Derby Presented by Lip Chip, LLC LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 100. Stakes Purse 200000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS. No nomination fee. $2,000 to pass the entry box and an additional $2,000 to start. Supplemental nomination of $8,000 will be accepted at time of entry and includes all fees. After payment of $4,000 to all owners finishing sixth throug h last, 60% of the remaining purse shall be paid to the winning owner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth, and 3% to fifth. Weights: 124 lbs. First preference will be given to highest lifetime earnings in Graded Stakes. Second preference to highes t lifetime earnings. Lifetime earnings will be determined according to statistics provided by Equibase. This race will be limited to Fourteen (14) starters. Horses not drawing a starting position in the gate will receive a refund of the entry fee. If les s than Fourteen (14) horses start, the purse money not distributed will revert to the winning owner. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Nominations Closed Saturday, August 19, 2023 with 34 Nominees.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BIG DATA ran off pace in the three path then had a late kick coming down the stretch. NO WHITE FLAGS ran in the three path with a slight kick at the beginning of the stretch. HOW DID HE DO THAT ran in the four path then had a late interest coming down the stretch. MACHINE GUN MAN ran on the rail set the early pace then was passed coming on to the stretch. TIZ DONEGAL ran in the two path throughout the race then faded mid way thru the second turn. PROMISE ME A RIDE got pushed out by DONEGAL ARROW in the first turn and was never able to regain. DONEGAL ARROW blew the first turn went into the back stretch eight wide and was never involved after that.

ENTRY.NAME: How Did He Do That
ENTRY.OWNER: Robison J Kirk and Robison Judy

ENTRY.NAME: Promise Me a Ride
ENTRY.OWNER: Kueber Racing LLC Big Easy Racing LLC and Schwartz Martin S

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 8 1M Turf CR: 88. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 27000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile O r Over On The Turf Since August 2 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JOHNNYSJOURNEY ran on the rail throughout the race, slowly increased its pace then had a strong final drive down the rail to win. CALICOCO set an early pace on the rail, then was caught at the sixteenth pole. ROCKET DOCTOR ran in the two path then had a late kick on the rail. TENSAS ALL OURS ran on the rail throughout the race maintained a steady pace. I DON'T VENMO ran at an even pace in the three path. CHARLIE G started off slow then made a mild gain on the outside. ONEFORVIVI ran in the two path trailing from the pack. PEPPER JACK ran on the rail of a pace from the leaders, then faded on the stretch. CAJUN EDDIE ran in the four path then got out ran when it approached the stretch. STANDING MAN ran off pace then ran out of gas when it came to the stretch. RIPITTOTHERIGHT ran off pace from the leaders then faded on the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Charlie G
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow mild gain on outside 3 wide

ENTRY.NAME: I Don't Venmo
ENTRY.OWNER: Robison J Kirk and Robison Judy

ENTRY.NAME: Johnnysjourney
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail increasing pace strong final drive on rail

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Linda Saffel, Lynn Mosley & Sandy DeHeer
